text: Does anyone know of the stat for the expected years of life lost due to COVID?  For smoking I have a vague memory that it is something like 10 years lost (e.g. if the average age is 86 then for a smoker it is 76).  I was thinking of calculating this myself if nobody else has.

elements.text: Does anyone know of the stat for the expected years of life lost due to COVID?  For smoking I have a vague memory that it is something like 10 years lost (e.g. if the average age is 86 then for a smoker it is 76).  I was thinking of calculating this myself if nobody else has.

text: I have a feeling it's going to be a long time before we understand the true extent of this. I'm guessing you're just asking about the top line number coming from acute deaths which you may be able to find, but the long term sequelae are only beginning to emerge
